thread.title: Twins plan new club, pub behind center field
thread.title_full: Twins plan new club, pub behind center field

title: Twins plan new club, pub behind center field
text:
Twins plan new club, pub behind center field By - Associated Press   
MINNEAPOLIS (AP) - The Minnesota Twins have made annual enhancements to Target Field since the ballpark opened in 2010. They’ve planned the most extensive renovation yet for next year, with an all-inclusive club section behind center field and a pub one level above it. 
The Twins announced Monday they’ll create a premium area for about 120 members called CATCH. Season ticket per-game prices will range from $75 to $85, with snacks and drinks included in the cost. Those tickets will be sold through a random selection process. 
On top of the new club will be a new pub called Minnie & Paul’s, in honor of the team’s original logo featured on the light-up sign that towers above the top deck. All ticket holders will have access to the space, with Minnesota-branded food featured.
